newsitem.title: USA: Spyglass falls 11 percent on earnings warning.
newsitem.headline: Spyglass falls 11 percent on earnings warning.

text.p: Shares of Spyglass Inc. fell 11 percent Thursday after the Internet software company said it would report a fiscal first-quarter loss at least 10 times worse than analysts had expected.
Spyglass slipped $1.36 to $11.14 on the Nasdaq market after it said it would report a loss of between 10 cents and 13 cents a share on revenues of $4 million.

According to First Call, which tracks analysts' estimates, Wall Street had been expecting a loss of just 1 cent on far greater revenues. In last year's fiscal first quarter, Spyglass reported a profit of $722,000, or 6 cents a share.
"I actually thought it would be worse," Mary McCaffrey, an analyst for Alex Brown & Sons, said, referring to the decline in the stock.

Spyglass said it would receive only a minimum royalty payment of $400,000 from Microsoft Corp. for the use of its Internet filter software in the Microsoft Internet Explorer. The software blocks access to objectionable material on the Internet.
Analysts, however, had expected the company to realise between $1 million and $2 million in revenues from Microsoft, based on financial models.
Spyglass, which is based in Naperville, Ill., said it would release its first-quarter results on Jan. 22.
